com.appglu.android.sync
Class SyncIntentServiceRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.appglu.android.sync.SyncIntentServiceRequest

public class SyncIntentServiceRequest
extends Object

Describes what the SyncIntentService is going to do during the Sync operation.

You can choose between:

  • Downloading the changes only or downloading and applying them immediately
  • Downloading files as well or only the data
  • Choose if all your tables are going to be synchronized or only the ones you want to
  • You can also choose to apply or discard previously downloaded changes
To start the Sync Service using a SyncIntentServiceRequest, see the following example:

SyncIntentServiceRequest request = SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncDatabaseAndFiles();
AppGlu.syncApi().startSyncIntentService(request);

The example above is going to start SyncIntentService and request it to download and apply changes to all of your tables as well as download all files that are new or updated.

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
SyncApi.startSyncIntentService(SyncIntentServiceRequest)
